cracking module¶

Cracking V0.2.3¶

## Input + raw section loss

## Output internal stress strain through the concrete cover and the location of the crack tip critical section loss to cause crack on the cover surface

### [update]

  • fully vectorizedd func with direct masking method

  • numpy func instead of vectorize to run faster

  • random variable

  • object

  • open crack width

  • u_p as a function of w/c

  • random r_v

  • P of f is not consistent between P_RS and crack_condition count. Because the R and S here are dependent: S.max() = R

  • Currently use crack_condition count. for example if 100% fully cracked, then R==S, Pf = 50%, wrong answer

### [TODO]

  • fix negative w_open (surface crack width)

cracking.bilinear_stress_strain(epsilon_theta, f_t, E_0)[source]¶

returns the stress in concrete from strain epsilon_thetan: numpy array, strain f_t : numpy array cracking tensile strength E_0 : numpy array modulus of elasticity [TODO: reduction due to creep]

Notes

cracking.crack_width_open(a, b, u_st, f_t, E_0)[source]¶

calculate crack opening on the concret cover surface :param a: inner radius boundary of the rust (center of rebar to rust-concrete) [m] :type a: np array :param b: outer radius boundary of the concrete (center of rebar to cover surface) [m] :type b: np array :param u_st: rust expansion(to original rebar surface) beyond the porous zone [m] :type u_st: array :param f_t: ultimate tensile strength [MPa] :type f_t: array :param E_0: modulus of elasticity [MPa] :type E_0: array

cracking.strain_f(r, a, b, u_st, f_t, E_0, crack_condition)[source]¶

returns the strain along the polar axis r, a<=r<=b non-vectorized :single value to single value

x_lossarray , column vector when passed through strain_stress_crack_f()

section loss [m]

everything is array r : is matrix with rows representing each r grid, column number is repeated values a: array

inner radius boundary of the rust (center of rebar to rust-concrete) [m]

barray

outer radius boundary of the concrete (center of rebar to cover surface) [m]

crack_condition: vector array 0 ‘sound cover’, 1 ‘partially cracked’, 2’fully cracked’

output: epsilon_theta matrix

cracking.strain_stress_crack_f(r, r0_bar, x_loss, cover, f_t, E_0, w_c, r_v, plot=False, ax=None)[source]¶

crack_condition for the whole concrete cover r is a matrix other scalar like are all array (to be converted to column vector in the calculation)
